Definition: Given a passage from a news article, identify whether the passage is related to world or sports or business or science/technology and label it as 'World', 'Sports', 'Business', 'Sci/Tech' respectively.

Positive Examples.input: Inauguration Gives GOP Fund-Raising Chance (AP) AP - The GOP is hoping to capitalize on President Bush's swearing-in ceremony next month, offering donors special inaugural packages that include access to lawmakers, a parade and galas.
Positive Examples.explanation: The passage from the news article is related to world issues. Hence, the label is 'World'.

Positive Examples.input: Arsenal cruise into knockout stage Arsenal have cruised into the knockout stage of the Champions League with an effortless 5-1 win over shambolic Norwegian champions Rosenborg Trondheim to win Group E at Highbury.
Positive Examples.explanation: The passage from the news article is related to sports. Hence, the label is 'Sports'.

Positive Examples.input: Time Warner profits hit by big legal reserve Time Warner Inc., the world #39;s largest media company, edged past Street estimates by a penny in its third-quarter results released Wednesday despite the creation of a big cash reserve related to its troubled AOL Internet unit.
Positive Examples.explanation: The passage from the news article is related to business. Hence, the label is 'Business'.

Positive Examples.input: Amazon CEO Bezos Sells 450,000 Shares for  #36;18.2 Mln (Reuters) Reuters - Amazon.com Inc.  Chairman and\Chief Executive Jeff Bezos sold a total of 450,000 shares in\the online retailer this week, for a total of  #36;18.2 million,\according to regulatory filings.
Positive Examples.explanation: The passage from the news article is related to science and technology. Hence, the label is 'Sci/Tech'.

Negative Examples.input: Anti-Kerry Ads Not Unfair, Laura Bush Says (Reuters) Reuters - First lady Laura Bush said on Sunday\that campaign advertisements accusing Democratic presidential\candidate John Kerry of lying about his Vietnam War record were\fair.
Negative Examples.explanation: The passage of the news article mentions about world issues. The label that is provided ('Sci/Tech') is wrong and should instead be 'World'.

Negative Examples.input: Australia #39;s Alinta: ACCC Won #39;t Oppose Dampier Pipe Bid-2- SYDNEY (Dow Jones)--Australian energy company Alinta Ltd. (ALN.AU) said Monday that Australia #39;s competition regulator won #39;t oppose its joint bid for the Dampier to Bunbury gas pipeline in Western Australia state.
Negative Examples.explanation: The passage of the news article mentions business relavant news. The label that is provided ('World') is wrong and should instead be 'Business'.

Negative Examples.input: GM pulls Corvette TV ad featuring underage driver Fast and sleek, the Chevy Corvette is the sports car of many a schoolboy #39;s dreams. And, for General Motors Corp., a PR nightmare.
Negative Examples.explanation: Although the passage mentions about driving a sports car, the topic is related to advertisement. So, this should be labelled as 'Business'.

quot;Hobbits quot; Found In Indonesia Exploding through the newsnets is the discovery of the remains of seven members of a tiny, previously unknown human species that survived until at least 13,000 years ago, and perhaps co-existed with modern humans right up to the present day.  Adult Homo Florensiensis, nicknamed "Hobbits" by the dig workers who helped uncover the remains at the Liang Bua cave on the island of Flores in Indonesia, were about the size of a three-year-old modern human child, but had a brain one-third the size. Stone tools and pygmy elephant bones found at the site indicate that these "Hobbits" hunted co-operatively together in groups, meaning that they must have had language. "The whole idea that you need a particular brain size to do anything intelligent is completely blown away by this find," commented Dr Henry Gee of Nature magazine to the BBC.

The system can handle as many as six 3.5-inch serial ATA drives and has a memory bandwidth of 12.8GB per SMP. As is the case in just about anything, people who have no understanding of something love to pick it apart. I'm sure we all know someone who refuses to fly. Their reasons most likely include "I just don't feel safe on those things." The fact is, really, that airline travel is exceedingly safe, and becoming ever safer. I will try to explain exactly why this is. I'd also like to introduce general aviation, and relate what I know about the future of air travel. It is a sad fact that the general public knows very little about aviation, and yet has so much to say about it.
